result.title: Output explanation needed (regarding sizeof(int) )
result.content:
Hi guys. 

#include <stdio.h>
  int main()
   {
   	   if (sizeof(int) > -1)
           printf("True");
       else
           printf("False");
   return 0;
   }

This outputs False. If I give any negative value , the output is False.

I don't understand why.

Shouldn't it be 4>-1 ?

If I replace -1 with 0,1,2 or 3, The output is True.
